Respondent’s details (person the aggrieved is seeking protection from)

The more information you provide about where {{respondentName}} lives or spends {{respondentTheir}} time the easier and quicker it will be for police to serve the application.

  1. Who {{doesTheAggrieved}} need protection from?
  9. {{DoesTheRespondent}} require an interpreter?
  11. {{IsTheRespondent}} from an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander background?
  12. {{DoesTheRespondent}} have a disability, illness or impairment where support and/or special arrangements are required?
  17. {{IsTheRespondent}} under 18 years of age?
  18. Parent’s details

    All documents must be given to a parent unless the court orders otherwise.
  19. Does {{respondentName}} have a weapon?
  21. Does {{respondentName}} have a weapons or firearms licence?

  22. Access to licensed weapon storage

    DO NOT accept the key to any secure weapons storage from {{respondentName}}. It is against the law to have a key to weapons unless you have a licence and permit.

    Contact Weapons Licensing (Queensland Police) as soon as possible for advice.
